intro: Symplocos tanakana, commonly known as the Indian gooseberry or amla, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are rich in vitamin C and other nutrients. Symplocos tanakana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both traditional medicine and ecological systems.
